page.title: 11BEEKEEPING - DOLPHINTON
page.content: Beekeeping depends on weather, "Flora" modern herbicides destroy many of th sources of nectar, eg. willowherb and agricultural insecticides kill the bees themselves. We no longer have hay meadows abounding in white clover, since intensive silage making has taken over. Dolphinton, a well shelted basin of cylindrical shape, is protected to South by wooded South Hill, to North by Black Mount and White Hill, rather open to East and cold east "haar", and unprotecred from the wet West. However, previous Mackenzies, the Lairds, planned the Estate well by planting many trees for shelter, including sycamore and lime, favourites of the honeybee (Apis mellifora) as well as conifers. August is main time for bees to work on our beautiful purple hill, covered in ling heather (calluna) to produce honey.
